name: Simple Habit Starter
description:
This is our signature 7 day introductory course to mindfulness meditation. In this series, you will learn the basic techniques of focus on the breath, the body and your senses so you can begin meditating right away.

Kate James is a mindfulness coach based in Melbourne, Australia. She teaches individuals and corporate groups the five principles of living and working mindfully and how those principles can be integrated into every day life.

Kate has been meditating for over 20 years. She runs meditation and yoga retreats in Byron Bay, Bali and Melbourne and she’s the author of bestselling books, Believe in Yourself & Do What You Love and Be Mindful & Simplify Your Life. She has two adult daughters and lives with her partner of 30 years.

name: Sleep Well
description: Guided by Jay Chodagam, this is a 7 day mindfulness course on sleeping like a champ.

name: Morning Meditation
description: In this series, Fuyuko Toyota will teach you how to start your morning delightful through meditation.

name: Find Happiness
description: It can be difficult to stay positive and find happiness when you are surrounded by so much negativity. In this series, Cory Muscara will help savor what is already good in your life, and shift negative situations into positive ones.

name: Follow Your Bliss
description:
How to be connected to your intuition and follow the guidance of your soul when you live in a stressful environment?
In this series, Amandine Roche will help to connect to your inner voice and live from the agenda of your soul.

name: Stop the War Within
description: 15 minute meditation practice to induce self-awareness and find inner peace.

name: Waiting at the Airport
description: This brief 5-minute meditation is designed to help you relax while waiting at an airport.

name: Just Landed
description: Decompress after your plane with this relaxing meditation.

name: Coffee Meditation
description: Meditate while enjoying your cup of coffee! This 5-minute meditation is a great energy boost.

name: Self-Control
description: Self Control is often considered the mother of all character strengths. Studies repeatedly show that people with high levels of self-control, able to delay gratification, are much more successful in all facets of life. In this series, Cory Muscara will guide you through the tools and strategies to improve self-control in your life.

name: Find Peace
description: Many consider inner peace to be the highest form of happiness. So often we are trying to change our external world to make us peaceful. What if we could find that peace regardless of what was happening in our lives? In this series, Cory will discuss how we can cultivate this inner peace for ourselves.

name: Find Happiness
description: It can be difficult to stay positive and find happiness when you are surrounded by so much negativity. In this series, Cory Muscara will help savor what is already good in your life, and shift negative situations into positive ones.

name: Unhurried Living
description: In this series with Dr. Larry Ward, learn to slow down and savor the moment.

name: Calm Anxiety
description: Looming deadlines, endless emails, alarming headlines—sometimes life seems designed to make you tense. The good news is that you can relax in the middle of it all. In this series, Anne Cushman gives you simple but powerful practices to stay calm and grounded no matter what’s going on.

name: Major Decisions
description: XYZ

name: Breakups
description: This meditation is designed to help anyone who's had a breakup and is going through changes in a close relationship.

name: Living with Gratitude
description: The quality of our life is a direct reflection of how much we appreciate ourselves and the people we love. Here are some simple practices to appreciate the most important people in your life, helping you feel more connected, clear and compassionate.

name: Fights & Challenges
description: XYZ

name: Sharpen Focus
description: What would you be able to do with greater focus? What if, instead of being swept away by distraction and mind-wandering, you could stay on task and disciplined, working toward what is most important to you in any given moment? How much different would your life be? In this series, Cory Muscara will guide you through the strategies and exercises that help develop the focus you need to be your best self.

name: Level 1: Attention
description: The ability to pay attention is central to every human activity. If you are good at concentrating, you can be better at whatever you do. The good news is that attention is a trainable skill. In this series you will build your “concentration power” with Michael W. Taft.

name: For College Students
description: In this series, Joseph Croskey will help you appreciate the challenges of collegiate life.

name: Break from Stressful Days
description: Having a stressful week? Take a quick break with Simple Habit's guided meditations by Jay Chodagam.

name: Level 2: Breath
description:
(Recommended pre-requisite: Attention Training)

Breathing is central to life. It’s the first action you take in life, and you do it over 20,000 times each day. Mindfulness of breathing is a central meditation technique which has many benefits. In this seven-part series you will learn mindfulness of breathing with Michael W. Taft.

name: Level 3: Body
description:
(Recommended pre-requisite: Breath Training)

We live our entire lives within our bodies, and yet rarely spend any time actually investigating the body’s feelings. Mindfulness of body sensations is a proven technique to help reduce stress, enhance creativity, and foster emotional intelligence. In this seven-part series you will learn mindfulness of body sensations with Michael W. Taft.

name: Level 4: Emotions
description:
(Recommended pre-requisite: Body Training)

For many people the most challenging area of life is the emotions. It’s no fun to have your life controlled by your emotional ups and downs. Luckily, mindfulness offers very helpful tools to better handle your emotions, and to enhance your emotional intelligence. In this seven-part series you will learn mindfulness of emotions with Michael W. Taft. 

Caveat: If you have intense trauma or PTSD, do these meditations very carefully, and possibly under the supervision of a therapist.

name: Feel at Peace
description: Many consider inner peace to be the highest form of happiness. So often we are trying to change our external world to make us peaceful. What if we could find that peace regardless of what was happening in our lives? In this series, Cory will discuss how we can cultivate this inner peace for ourselves.

name: Find Peace
description: Many consider inner peace to be the highest form of happiness. So often we are trying to change our external world to make us peaceful. What if we could find that peace regardless of what was happening in our lives? In this series, Cory will discuss how we can cultivate this inner peace for ourselves.

name: Level 5: Mind
description:
(Recommended pre-requisite: Emotions Training)

Most people think that meditation means to stop thinking. But you can actually learn to have a very deep and satisfying meditation even when your mind is full of thoughts. Found out how in this seven-part series about mindfulness of thinking with Michael W. Taft.

name: Self-Control
description: Self Control is often considered the mother of all character strengths. Studies repeatedly show that people with high levels of self-control, able to delay gratification, are much more successful in all facets of life. In this series, Cory Muscara will guide you through the tools and strategies to improve self-control in your life.

name: Level 6: Awareness
description:
(Recommended pre-requisite: Mind Training)

Most meditation practices center around training attention. In this series, however, we concentrate on awareness itself. Working with awareness is both very simple and very profound. In this series you will learn how to do open monitoring meditation, as well as dwell in the perfection of the moment, with Michael W. Taft.

name: Attention Training
description: The ability to pay attention is central to every human activity. If you are good at concentrating, you can be better at whatever you do. The good news is that attention is a trainable skill. In this series you will build your “concentration power” with Michael W. Taft.

name: For Lawyers
description: Practicing law can be brutal.  The pressures and stresses of practicing our profession are legendary.  In this series Grosvenor Burnett, J.D teaches lawyers the skills to survive the practice of law and not burn out and go insane!

name: Reduce Stress
description: Stress is something we all face, and in large doses it can prevent us from showing up at our best, living well, and helping others. Peter Bonanno will introduce you to several practices to reduce stress in a few minutes per day.

name: Thought Detox
description: We are all addicted to thought. It’s an epidemic. So what can we do? In this series, Kelly will share with you simple yet profound practices that give you a break from thinking. You can’t control thoughts arising in your mind, but you can control how much attention and energy you give them.

name: Calm Anxiety
description: Looming deadlines, endless emails, alarming headlines—sometimes life seems designed to make you tense. The good news is that you can relax in the middle of it all. In this series, Anne Cushman gives you simple but powerful practices to stay calm and grounded no matter what’s going on.

name: Weight Control
description: Weight control is always a hard task. Let Gayle help you with her guided meditation.

name: Can't Sleep
description: Try this meditation when you can’t go to sleep. Relax and prepare to go to bed.

name: Deep Sleep 1
description: Explore a deep, restful state of sleep in this series with Anne Douglas. Learn the tools to relax, let go, and drift into deep sleep.

name: Enhance Your Workflow
description: In this meditation series with Quentin Finney, learn various techniques you can use to do better at work.

name: Clarity for Leaders
description: In this series with Mark Prior, sharpen your leadership skills by cultivating a sense of clarity and perspective. Learn mindfulness techniques that will help you approach problems with greater self-awareness.

name: Feeling Tired
description: This 5-minute meditation will help you through feelings of fatigue and drowsiness.

name: Ease Discomfort
description: This five-minute meditation with Jay Chodagam will help you relax into discomfort.

name: Headaches & Fever
description: This meditation is structured to help us relax despite the discomfort and change our relationship with pain. Instead of resisting discomfort, which is a natural tendency, we first attend to the breath and our body to relax parts of the body that are holding tension we don't need to. Then we turn toward the headache itself.  In turning toward the pain with a gentle awareness and kindness, we are able to see the pain as a changing phenomena in the body instead of something static and solid. Seeing the shifting and changing quality of pain makes it more tolerable and we can learn to relax into it.

name: After Vacation
description: This short meditation session will help you transition to your regular lifestyle after vacation.

name: Procrastination Remedy
description: Breaking the procrastination habit is hard to do. In this series with Shalini Bahl, you will learn to tackle the underlying reasons for procrastination. With a daily commitment of just 5 minutes, you will develop different mindfulness practices to overcome seven causes of procrastination.

name: Procrastination Remedy
description: Breaking the procrastination habit is hard to do. In this series with Shalini Bahl, you will learn to tackle the underlying reasons for procrastination. With a daily commitment of just 5 minutes, you will develop different mindfulness practices to overcome seven causes of procrastination.

name: Find Happiness
description: It can be difficult to stay positive and find happiness when you are surrounded by so much negativity. In this series, Cory Muscara will help savor what is already good in your life, and shift negative situations into positive ones.

name: Start a New Job
description: Starting a New Job is often likened to “drinking from a firehose.” It can be a stressful and overwhelming experience. In this series, Ali Niederkorn will help you not only maintain balance through the process, but take an empowering approach to a new beginning.

name: Breath Energizer
description: Often we go through a whole day and never really take a full, deep breath. A few minutes of deep breathing can make all the difference. In this series, Ali Niederkorn will help you find that full, replenishing breath.

name: Resilience for Women
description: This is a meditation series created for women by a woman. In this series with Shalini Bahl you will be building skills to deal with different challenges and add more joy to your life. With a daily commitment of just 5 minutes, you will explore different mindfulness practices that are foundational for developing confidence, resilience and ease.

name: Healthy Relationships
description: How do you build a healthy relationship? In this series, Elli will guide you through how to apply mindfulness practice to your relationships, whether with a partner, family member, or friend, to help cultivate understanding, love and more happiness all around!

name: Mindful Communication
description:
“Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.” – Victor Frankl
 
In this series, Kamala will share tools that will empower you to choose to respond to others with openness, compassion, and empathy, rather than reacting.

name: Procrastination Remedy
description: Breaking the procrastination habit is hard to do. In this series with Shalini Bahl, you will learn to tackle the underlying reasons for procrastination. With a daily commitment of just 5 minutes, you will develop different mindfulness practices to overcome seven causes of procrastination.

name: Learn To Rest
description: Without proper rest and recovery, our performance declines and our overall ability to tolerate stress diminishes. In this series, Michael Rich will help you learn how to apply mindful awareness in order to access the benefits of rest and nervous system recovery.

name: Happiness at Work
description: What are some secrets to happiness at work? Figure it out with Jay Chodagam, a TEDx lecturer.

name: Everyday Mindfulness
description: There are little moments everyday where we have the opportunity to apply mindfulness! In this series, Elli will share with you simple practices that apply to the activities you are already doing daily to seamlessly infuse mindfulness into your life.

name: Compassion
description: We are hard-wired to be compassionate. Yet sometimes we get out of practice, especially with difficult people. Practicing compassion is not only good for others, but it can help you feel more meaning, connection and love within yourself. In this series, Kelly will share with you practices that help you feel warmth and care towards others and to see the humanity within them more regularly.

name: Thought Detox
description: We are all addicted to thought. It’s an epidemic. So what can we do? In this series, Kelly will share with you simple yet profound practices that give you a break from thinking. You can’t control thoughts arising in your mind, but you can control how much attention and energy you give them.

description: In this series with Kamala, meditate to feel at ease while on your period.

name: Illness
description: When illness enters one’s life, it can be an all-consuming source of stress and compromise one’s quality of life.  Whether your looking for short-term support for a temporary health set back, or long term support for chronic malaise, this meditation series offers helpful tools for healing and managing what ails you.

name: Calm Anxiety
description: Looming deadlines, endless emails, alarming headlines—sometimes life seems designed to make you tense. The good news is that you can relax in the middle of it all. In this series, Anne Cushman gives you simple but powerful practices to stay calm and grounded no matter what’s going on.

name: Being My Optimal Self
description: How to optimize your life? Take your first step with Holly!

name: Rain
description: Relax to the sound of rain.

name: Ocean
description: Relax to the sound of ocean waves.

name: Simple Habit Podcast
description: Our weekly podcast is brought to you exclusively by former monk and meditation teacher Cory Muscara. Each week, Cory speaks on a topic in mindfulness, from positive psychology to the nature of the human mind.

name: Good Morning
description: Start a day with quick 5 minute meditation.

name: Reduce Stress
description: Stress is something we all face, and in large doses it can prevent us from showing up at our best, living well, and helping others. Peter Bonanno will introduce you to several practices to reduce stress in a few minutes per day.

name: Deal with Internal Critic
description: Painful early life experiences can form a pattern of destructive thoughts toward ourselves and others. It may sabotage our successes or our relationships, preventing us from living with care and ease. So how can we challenge this inner voice? Here are some useful practices that can transform this voice of harsh critique to a feeling of warm understanding.

name: Self-Control
description: Self Control is often considered the mother of all character strengths. Studies repeatedly show that people with high levels of self-control, able to delay gratification, are much more successful in all facets of life. In this series, Cory Muscara will guide you through the tools and strategies to improve self-control in your life.

name: Open Your Heart
description: Feel the heart area, place of deep feelings such as love, gratitude, appreciation and compassion.

name: Cultivate Awareness
description: Explore what it feels like to be more spacious and free.

name: Create Harmony
description: Practice this meditation with John and briefly explore what it feels like to be more inwardly aligned.

name: Breath of Compassion
description: Practice meditation with compassion for humanity and other living beings.

name: Take a Deep Breath
description: Be aware of the space and better understand your surroundings as well as yourself.

name: Breath-Based Body Scan
description: Breathe, meditate and be aware of your body.

name: Release Tension
description: Suffering from tension and stress? Try out this meditation together with Vidyamala.

name: Before a Meeting
description: Meditating before a meeting can be an effective way to develop a calm and collaborative mindset. In this series with Quentin Finney, learn different techniques you can use before a meeting to relax and boost focus.

name: Be More Self-Aware
description: Self-awareness is an important part of reducing stress, living healthier, being an effective leader, and connecting with others in a more authentic way. Become more self-aware with this series by Shalini Bahl.

name: Restful Nap
description: Recharge with this 8-minute meditation for restful naps, guided by Richard Miller.

name: Be at Ease
description: In this 8-minute meditation with Richard Miller, explore what it means to just simply be with ease.

name: Gratitude Practice
description: Explore what it means to practice and live with gratitude in this meditation by Richard Miller.

name: Relationships At Work
description:
Want more ease, confidence, and resilience in your relationships at work? Peter Bonanno will introduce you to a few practices to better connect with others.

Peter is a social entrepreneur, mindfulness trainer for businesses and nonprofits, and Director of Program Development at Search Inside Yourself Leadership Institute. He’s inspired to help people live brilliantly and with a lot of heart.

name: Relieve Pain
description: Learn to approach pain with ease, compassion, and patience in this series by Anne Douglas.

name: Easy Focus
description: Studies show that we are lost in thought almost 50% of the time, which means that almost half your life you’re not here! This series is to help you hone your capacity to focus on the task at hand and direct your mind to the present moment.

name: Lunch Break Boost
description: In this series with Quentin Finney, leverage your lunch break to boost your productivity and satisfaction at work.

name: Dealing with Depression
description:
Millions of people all over the world are dealing with depression. Anne Douglas skilfully helps you find peace within, and navigate your way back to Joyful Living. 

Anne Douglas is a meditation teacher, life-coach and yoga therapist. She travels internationally to teach trainings, retreats and workshops and is the Director of Trainers for the Integrative Restoration Institute. With over 30 years of experience in health education, Anne offers exceptional tools for well being. Anne lives in the beautiful Rocky Mountain town of Banff, Alberta, Canada.

name: Study Break Boost
description: Your 5-minute study break with Cory Muscara.

description: Cultivate some calm before your interview with this 5-minute meditation.

Led by an engineer for engineers, this meditation will help clear your mind for sharper problem-solving and insight.

Edward is the co-founder and CTO of Gusto where oversees engineering and software development at Gusto.

Millions of people all over the world are dealing with depression. Anne Douglas skilfully helps you find peace within, and navigate your way back to Joyful Living. 

Anne Douglas is a meditation teacher, life-coach and yoga therapist. She travels internationally to teach trainings, retreats and workshops and is the Director of Trainers for the Integrative Restoration Institute. With over 30 years of experience in health education, Anne offers exceptional tools for well being. Anne lives in the beautiful Rocky Mountain town of Banff, Alberta, Canada.

description: Rediscover your original self-confidence in this series. Peter Bonanno shows you how to settle the mind, be in the flow of the moment, and simply be comfortable in your own skin.

name: Release Fear
description: These 5-minute guided meditations offer mindfulness practices for working with and letting go of fear. They offer support for cultivating presence, equanimity, clear seeing, and courage in the face of fear.

description: Painful early life experiences can form a pattern of destructive thoughts toward ourselves and others. It may sabotage our successes or our relationships, preventing us from living with care and ease. So how can we challenge this inner voice? Here are some useful practices that can transform this voice of harsh critique to a feeling of warm understanding.

description: Whether it's a business trip, vacation, visit to home, or anything else, this 5-minute meditation will help you feel prepared and relax before your upcoming travels.

description: This meditation will help you accept reality as it is, however it's turned out to be.

description: This meditation series by Jeff Foster touches upon the themes of deep rest, awakening from self-judgement, sinking into the present moment, and feeling completely at home in oneself. Take a journey into self-love and total quietness of mind.

name: Deep Rest
description: This extended meditation will help you rest effortlessly into the present moment and feel completely immersed in where you are. Use the ever-present rise and fall of your breath as an anchor to the here and now. Perfect before sleep.

name: Body Scan
description: Bring a feeling of ease to your entire body with this gentle guided body scan.

description: In the busyness of our daily lives, it can be hard to appreciate the person we spend the most amount of time with: ourselves. This meditation will help you bring kindness to yourself and find ease in your day.

name: Let It Go

description: In this 15 minute meditation, learn to release blame and forgive—whether it be yourself, a loved one, or something else.

description: This 10 minute deep sleep practice will invite you to work with any thoughts or emotions that may be keeping you awake at night.

name: Tea Meditation
description: Drinking tea can be a special and soothing ritual. Listen to this 3-minute meditation as you enjoy your cup of tea.
